noun.description: A sympathomimetic agent with stimulant effects on the central nervous system similar to those of dexamphetamine, used chiefly as an appetite suppressant. [Chemical name: 3-methyl-2-phenylmorpholine, C11H15NO. A trademark for this drug is Preludin.]

origin: 1950s. From phen- + met- + -r-, linking element + azine.
